content: Restaurant in Singapore **Sin Huat Eating House** is a restaurant located in [Geylang](/wiki/Geylang), Singapore. It is run by Danny Lee and primarily serves seafood dishes, including [crab bee hoon](/wiki/Crab_bee_hoon). ## Description Sin Huat Eating House is located in [Geylang](/wiki/Geylang), Singapore. The restaurant primarily serves seafood dishes, including [crab bee hoon](/wiki/Crab_bee_hoon) (crab with [rice vermicelli](/wiki/Rice_vermicelli)), poached *[gong gong](/wiki/Laevistrombus_canarium)*, and [frog legs](/wiki/Frog_legs). There is also a [braised duck rice](/wiki/Duck_rice) stall within the premises. ## Reception [Anthony Bourdain](/wiki/Anthony_Bourdain) described the restaurant's premises as a "sweltering dump open to the street and the prostitutes of Geylang", but listed it as one of the "13 Places to Eat Before You Die". Singaporean food critic [KF Seetoh](/wiki/KF_Seetoh) wrote that the restaurant was a "culinary sensation". The restaurant was featured in the [Michelin Guide](/wiki/Michelin_Guide)'s [Bib Gourmand](/wiki/Michelin_Guide#Bib_Gourmand) in 2016, 2017, 2018, 2019, and 2021. This Asia-based restaurant or restaurant chain article is a stub. You can help Wikipedia by expanding it. - v - t - e
title: Sin Huat Eating House
